response: narrative=Sandra Simpson was last seen leaving a rehab center near her part-time job. She planned to attend a concert venue with her friend, Jason French. Suffering stress from a chronic illness and undiagnosed mental illness, she was later found hiding in a closet at Stirling Road, Dumbarton.

narrative=Sandra Simpson was last seen leaving an after-school program at 112-117 West Clyde Street, Helensburgh, G84 8ES. She had planned to visit a friend at 52a Sinclair Street, Helensburgh, G84 8TQ but never arrived. Concerns grew as Sandra, who was under a foster care arrangement, had a history of wandering due to her unspecified disability. Initial sightings placed her near 1a The Auld Road, G67 2RF, where a local reported seeing a girl matching her description disoriented and asking for directions. It was believed that Sandra became confused and unintentionally strayed further from her intended destination. Her high-risk status prompted a swift search operation, leading to her being located safely and returned to her guardians.

narrative=Sandra Simpson vanished after leaving an after-school program in the bustling urban district. It is believed she may have disappeared after an online interaction. Her foster sister, Joan Smith, became concerned when Sandra failed to arrive at the volunteer organization on Turret Crescent, G13 2HG. A search at nearby urban environments, including a concert venue, was initially unsuccessful. The police later traced her to Hall Road, Rhu, G84 8RR.
narrative=Sandra Simpson disappeared after an online interaction with friend Jason French at a school-related concert venue in Glasgow.
narrative=Sandra Simpson was last seen by her foster father at their home. A friend reported her missing, and she was found by police in a closet at 52a Sinclair Street, Helensburgh, G84 8TQ.

narrative=Sandra Simpson, a 16-year-old under foster care, was initially reported missing from her address on 21 Rampart Avenue, Glasgow. She was last seen at a friend's house earlier in the day, displaying emotional distress. Sandra's foster father reported that she had been struggling recently and frequently sought solitude in unconventional places, such as closets, to escape her reality. Despite having a low initial risk level, her disappearance raised concerns due to her disability and recent attendance at a local rehab center. The urban environment of Fulton Road, with its complex network of streets, was searched thoroughly by authorities, but Sandra remained elusive. Thankfully, she was eventually located by police on Stirling Road, Dumbarton, safe and unharmed.
